desc: A palette of Color constants that describe colors commonly used when matching the iOS platform aesthetics.
name: cupertino.CupertinoColors

props.desc:
iOS 10's default blue color. Used to indicate active elements such as buttons, selected tabs and your own chat bubbles.

This is SystemBlue in the iOS palette.
props.example:
Implementation

static const Color activeBlue = Color(0xFF007AFF)
props.name: activeBlue

props.desc:
iOS 10's default green color. Used to indicate active accents such as the switch in its on state and some accent buttons such as the call button and Apple Map's 'Go' button.

This is SystemGreen in the iOS palette.
props.example:
Implementation

static const Color activeGreen = Color(0xFF4CD964)
props.name: activeGreen

props.desc:
iOS 12's default dark mode color. Used in place of the activeBlue color as the default active elements' color when the theme's brightness is dark.

This is SystemOrange in the iOS palette.
props.example:
Implementation

static const Color activeOrange = Color(0xFFFF9500)
props.name: activeOrange

props.desc:
Opaque black color. Used for texts against light backgrounds.

This is SystemBlackColor in the iOS palette.

See also:

  • material.Colors.black, the same color, in the material design palette.
  • white, opaque white in the CupertinoColors palette.
props.example:
Implementation

static const Color black = Color(0xFF000000)
props.name: black

props.desc: Used in iOS 12 for very dark background fills in tables between cell groups in dark mode.
props.example:
Implementation

static const Color darkBackgroundGray = Color(0xFF171717)
props.name: darkBackgroundGray

props.desc:
Used for iOS 10 for destructive actions such as the delete actions in table view cells and dialogs.

Not the same red as the camera shutter or springboard icon notifications or the foreground red theme in various native apps such as HealthKit.

This is SystemRed in the iOS palette.
props.example:
Implementation

static const Color destructiveRed = Color(0xFFFF3B30)
props.name: destructiveRed

props.desc:
Used in iOS 12 for very light background fills in tables between cell groups.

This is SystemExtraLightGrayColor in the iOS palette.
props.example:
Implementation

static const Color extraLightBackgroundGray = Color(0xFFEFEFF4)
props.name: extraLightBackgroundGray

props.desc:
Used in iOS 11 for unselected selectables such as tab bar items in their inactive state or de-emphasized subtitles and details text.

Not the same gray as disabled buttons etc.

This is SystemGrayColor in the iOS palette.
props.example:
Implementation

static const Color inactiveGray = Color(0xFF8E8E93)
props.name: inactiveGray

props.desc:
Used in iOS 10 for light background fills such as the chat bubble background.

This is SystemLightGrayColor in the iOS palette.
props.example:
Implementation

static const Color lightBackgroundGray = Color(0xFFE5E5EA)
props.name: lightBackgroundGray

props.desc:
Opaque white color. Used for backgrounds and fonts against dark backgrounds.

This is SystemWhiteColor in the iOS palette.

See also:

  • material.Colors.white, the same color, in the material design palette.
  • black, opaque black in the CupertinoColors palette.
props.example:
Implementation

static const Color white = Color(0xFFFFFFFF)
props.name: white
